title: Publish the app and provide a publicly accessible URL

requirements.text: Deploy the application (frontend + backend canisters) to the Internet Computer mainnet so it is publicly accessible without local tooling.

quotes: Please  publish  and provide the url, so that it can be viewed by everyone

acceptanceCriteria: The app is deployed to the IC mainnet (not local replica).
A user can access the app from a standard browser on a separate network/machine without any local build steps.
The deployment produces stable canister IDs for both frontend and backend canisters.

requirements.text: Provide the public URL for the deployed app in a human-readable form within the repository (e.g., in a root-level README) and ensure it matches the deployed frontend canister URL.

quotes: provide the url, so that it can be viewed by everyone

acceptanceCriteria: A root-level README (or equivalent project documentation file) includes the exact public URL to access the app.
The documented URL loads the deployed app successfully and shows the SPA (not a 404).

requirements.text: Add an in-app “Share” area that displays the current page URL and allows copying it to the clipboard, so users can easily share the publicly accessible link.
acceptanceCriteria: The UI shows the current full URL (including the selected Veda/mantra path when present).
A copy action copies the URL to clipboard and provides a visible success state in English.
The feature works in modern browsers without requiring authentication.

constraints: Backend must remain single-actor (all Motoko logic in backend/main.mo).
Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutablePaths; compose existing UI components instead.
nonGoals: Adding third-party hosting (AWS/Vercel/Netlify) or non-IC deployment targets.
Changing mantra content/data unless required for deployment stability.

preferencesToAdd: User-facing text must be in English.
